channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Opinion: Alternate endings for modern attention spans
item.description: Some film professors are bemoaning the shortcuts students take to avoid watching assigned movies: some don't know what happens at the end. NPR's Scott...

item.title: Lindsey Vonn is set to ski the Olympic downhill race with a torn ACL. How?
item.description: An ACL tear would keep almost any other athlete from competing -- but not Lindsey Vonn, the 41-year-old superstar skier who is determined to cap off a...

item.title: They're cured of leprosy. Why do they still live in leprosy colonies?
item.description: Leprosy is one of the least contagious diseases around — and perhaps one of the most misunderstood. The colonies are relics of a not-too-distant past ...

item.title: After the Fall: How Olympic figure skaters soar after stumbling on the ice
item.description: Olympic figure skating is often seems to take athletes to the very edge of perfection, but even the greatest stumble and fall. How do they pull themse...

item.title: This season, 'The Pitt' is about what doesn't happen in one day
item.description: The first season of The Pitt was about acute problems. The second is about chronic ones.

item.title: Swiss skier Franjo von Allmen wins first gold medal of Milano Cortina Games
item.description: The second gold medal of the Milano Cortina Games was awarded to Frida Karlsson of Sweden in the women's 10km+10km skiathlon.

item.title: Chef and author Noor Murad on her latest cookbook
item.description: Noor Murad's latest cookbook is a love letter to the Middle Eastern flavors she is known for using in her dishes.

item.title: Key storylines to pay attention to at Super Bowl LX
item.description: The Seattle Seahawks are set to face off against the New England Patriots on Sunday in Super Bowl LX, and "CBS Saturday Morning" goes inside key story...

item.title: General shot in Moscow conscious after surgery, Russian media say
item.description: Lt Gen Vladimir Alexeyev was shot several times inside his apartment block on Friday morning.

item.title: Trump threatens tariffs for countries trading with Iran
item.description: The order did not specify the rate that could be imposed, but used 25% as an example.

item.title: S Korean crypto firm accidentally pays out $40bn in bitcoin
item.description: The company quickly realised its mistake and managed to recover virtually all the missing tokens from customers.

item.title: Best books for Valentine's Day
item.description: Sarah Gelman, editorial director at Amazon Books, joins "CBS Saturday Morning" to recommend some of the best books to read around Valentine's Day.

item.title: Super Bowl food that's bound to go viral
item.description: Super Bowl chefs spend an entire year developing the menu for the big game, and "CBS Saturday Morning" gets a sneak peek at some of the mouth-watering...

item.title: US wants Russia and Ukraine to end war by June, says Zelensky
item.description: The Ukrainian leader says difficult issues remain, as Russia carries out further strikes on energy facilities.

item.title: Zambian leader backs traditional Ghanaian outfit after online trolling
item.description: Some Zambians outraged Ghanaians by describing the outfit worn by their president as a "blouse".

item.title: Sheriff searching for Savannah Guthrie’s missing mom calls lack of video a disappointing setback
item.description: The sheriff investigating the apparent abduction of “Today” show host Savannah Guthrie’s mother says it’s frustrating that a camera at Nancy Guthrie’s...

item.title: Trump’s racist post about Obamas is deleted after backlash despite White House earlier defending it
Savannah Guthrie’s demand for mom’s ‘proof of life’ is complicated in this era of AI and deepfakes
